description: a(n) = n+r where r is the smallest number such that n divides (n+1)(n+2)(n+3)...(n+r).
comments: It is conjectured that a(n) = n + A002034(n)._Dean Hickerson_ remarks (Oct 07 2001) that the above conjecture is easy to prove: (n+1)(n+2)...(n+r) is congruent to r! (mod n), so n divides (n+1)(n+2)...(n+r) if and only if n divides r!.
example: a(6) = 9 as 6 divides 7 * 8 * 9 but does not divide 7 * 8.
mathematica: a[n_] := For[r=1, True, r++, If[Mod[r!, n]==0, Return[n+r]]]
